author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Pongal festival has brought much joy to cattle farmers here too. For the last one week, the goats have been in good demand, as the non-vegetarian food used to be the main item in the daily menu on the ‘Karinaal’ which falls on January 17.

The Mecheri cattle weekly market witnessed a brisk business on Wednesday. The second major occupation of the farmers of Malliyakuntham; Pallipatti; Thettigiripatti; Amaram; Vellar; Pukkampatti; Koppampatti; Kuttapatti; Panapuram; Satthapadi is goat rearing, behind agriculture. More than 4,000 goats were sold out at the market on Wednesday alone. Due to heavy demand, the price of goats registered an upward trend. A goat weighing 10 kg, which was priced at Rs. 4,700 in Mecheri Market last week, was sold for Rs. 5,200 on Wednesday. The Konganapuram weekly cattle market registered a sale of 7,500 goats worth Rs. 4 crore on last Saturday. The goats weighing 20 kg fetched a price of about Rs. 9,000 in Konganapuram market.
title: Price of goats shoots up
